Trial_Design.evidence: Five-hundred patients were included in this study and randomly distributed to SP or simple head extension.

Intervention.evidence: In the sniffing group, an incompressible head ring was placed under the head to raise its height by 7 cm from the neutral plane followed by maximal extension of the head. In the simple extension group, no headrest was placed under the head; however, maximal head extension was given at the time of laryngoscopy.

Objective.evidence: We conducted a prospective study comparing the sniffing head position with simple head extension to study the laryngoscopic view and intubation difficulty during direct laryngoscopy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Various factors as ability to mask ventilate, laryngoscopic visualization, intubation difficulty, and posture of the anesthesiologist during laryngoscopy and tracheal intubation were noted.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly distributed to SP or simple head extension

Number_Randomised.evidence: Five-hundred patients were included in this study

Result_Outcome.evidence: The IDS score differed significantly between sniffing group and simple extension group ( P = 0.000) with an increased difficulty during intubation in the simple head extension.
